section: Company guarantees to deliver the Client Website in the time frame specified in the Scope of Work. Terms of the project: 12 weeks from February 8, 2018 to May 3, 2018. Client acknowledges and agrees that any due dates set forth in the Scope of Work are not subject to any delay.
explanation: This section contains an internal inconsistency. While it 'guarantees' a delivery timeframe, it also states that due dates 'are not subject to any delay'. This creates confusion: guarantees imply potential compensation for missed deadlines, but the 'no delay' clause suggests that any deviation from the timeline is acceptable, negating the guarantee.

section: Client may be asked to pay an additional surcharge for any services requiring work to be performed outside of normal business hours by reason of a rush deadline requested by Client or as a result of Client's failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials. The surcharge for rush work may be different from the standard hourly rate.
explanation: The wording in this section is ambiguous because the text states 'may be asked'. It is not clear that the client has an obligation to pay the additional surcharge. It creates ambiguity about when the surcharge applies, how it is determined, and whether the client can refuse to pay it.

section: The surcharge for rush work may be different from the standard hourly rate.
explanation: This creates ambiguity in text. There is no defined hourly rate. The client does not know the fee for a job as the text says that it 'may be different from the standard hourly rate'.
